message: I have a problem that I can't concentrate at all in open offices. Some people try to put on earbuds and listen to songs, others listen to instrumental no-lyrics stuff, I tired both, but nothing worked. I still really distracted, and  my productivity is not high at all. Any Advice, please?

data.message: I have a similar problem. I usually use white/natural noise generators - surprisingly effective at blocking out surrounding noise. There's an android app (from Relaxio I think) that has presets for rain, thunderstorms, distant traffic, .. etc. with separate volume controls so you can "mix". And there are plenty of websites and youtube listings for similar stuff also.
Thank you so much for you reply, but unfortunately I tried that as well, and it didn't work with me :(

If you mean that your problem is not only about blocking audio noise, but you may also need to block visual noise then may be try to get a big screen, or change your office so that you are looking away from people, may be look at a blocked view like a wall or a distant view like a window.
I can deal with visual noise, but the real problem with the sounds, everyone is talking and discussing, either with client or with an employee
Also I can't move, as I don't have laptop at work
Have you tried noise cancellation headphones? Have you tried pomodoro technique? Giving yourself short intervals of deadline to focus? Have you tried Quraan or even audio books?
Try active noise cancelling headphones, they are somehow expensive, but they are worth it in your case.

I haven't tried noise cancellation headphones, but I tried to take a walk or go downstairs and upstairs and walk to the colder to drink water almost every hour, and yes, I've tried Quraan and audio books :(

Invest in a good noise canceling headset
It is worth it
The Bose QC23 is a very nice one
The problem is how to focus without losing your ability to hear in the near future :S
